headerDisplay: Note: This plugin can auto-configure the UPS Management interface.
footerDisplay: This plugin requires curl. To use auto-discovery and configuration, it also requires: net-tools, arping, xxd and socat. Install in OS before restarting HomeBridge using sudo apt install curl, net-tools, arping, xxd, socat

autoConfigure.title: Auto-configure UPS Management Interface
autoConfigure.description: Automatically configure the UPS with the IP address set below when plugin is started.

upsIpAddress.title: UPS IP Address
upsIpAddress.description: UPS IP address to use (and configure, if using autoConfigure). Enter 0.0.0.0 to configure the UPS for DHCP.

apcUsername.title: UPS Username
apcUsername.description: The configured username for the management interface, if this has been set.

apcPassword.title: UPS Password
apcPassword.description: The configured password for the management interface, if this has been set (note: characters only, no numbers).

statusCommand.title: Shell script to retrieve UPS status JSON object and control the outlets

configureCommand.title: Shell script to configure the UPS Management Interface

pollInterval.title: Interval (in seconds) to poll the status

form.title: UPS Management Interface
form.description: These settings define how to reach the UPS.

form.title: Display Settings
form.description: These settings control how the UPS information will be displayed within HomeKit.

form.title: Outlet Control
form.description: Locking outlets prevents their current state being changed using HomeKit. They can however still be rebooted if that option is enabled.

form.title: Alert thresholds
form.description: These settings define when HomeKit shows alert conditions.

form.title: Advanced Settings
form.description: Don't change these, unless you understand what you're doing.
